Ghulam Mujtaba

Postdoctoral Scholar, West Virginia University, Morgantown, West Virginia, USA

Best way to reach me is via email.

I bring a rich blend of academic and industrial experience to the computer vision and deep learning domain. Holding a Ph.D. in Computer Engineering from Gachon University, I focused on personalized multimedia generation for resource-constrained devices at the Multimedia Computing Systems Laboratory (MCSLab) under the guidance of Prof. Eun-Seok Ryu. My academic background includes a Master of Science in Computer Science from Indus University and a Bachelor of Science in Computer Science from COMSATS Institute of Information Technology in Pakistan. As a specialized computer vision researcher, I excel in utilizing deep learning techniques for visual analysis, multimedia retrieval, and image processing. I am dedicated to advancing computer vision and deep learning in both academic and industrial settings.

Education

    Doctor of Philosophy,
    Gachon University, Seongnam, South Korea
    Computer Engineering
    • Lightweight Client-driven Personalized Multimedia Framework for Next Generation Streaming Platforms

Work

  • 2023.04 - Present
    Postdoctoral Researcher
    West Virginia University, Morgantown, WV, USA
    Conducting cutting-edge research and developing state-of-the-art deep learning models for medical image/video data analysis, specializing in multi-label classification of ChexNet X-ray images. Exploring the latest advancements in ChatGPT, Generative AI, and LLMs while contributing to increased research productivity.
  • 2022.03 - 2023.03
    Research Engineer
    C-JeS Gulliver Studio, Seoul, South Korea
    Achieved 20% higher realism in digital-human characters by applying advanced deep learning techniques for Metaverse applications. Reduced production time by 30% through innovative 2D to 3D conversion methods. Authored two research papers, elevating the studio's reputation in digital-human technology.
  • 2021.10 - 2022.02
    Senior Researcher
    DeltaX.ai, Seoul, South Korea
    Developed deep learning techniques for human activity recognition, with a focus on violence detection in videos and images. Collaborated on the Self-Driving Data Contest 2021 and identified growth opportunities in emerging markets.
  • 2019.09 - 2021.09
    Visiting Researcher
    Sungkyunkwan University, Seoul, South Korea
    Pioneered thumbnail-based video analysis for streaming platforms, achieving a 3.57% boost in computational efficiency. Developed disclosure documents for intellectual property protection and authored research manuscripts, raising the lab's academic profile.
  • 2018.03 - 2021.06
    Graduate Research Assistant
    Gachon University, Seongnam, South Korea
    Participated in developing AI-based healthcare solutions for seniors and collaborated on multiview video surveillance summarization algorithms.
